messageBody:
If it is an external client (i.e. not being run in the AppServer or
WebServer JVM then you need the following:


Properties properties = System.getProperties();
InitialContext context = null;

//
// Set the system properties
//

properties.put(Context.INITIAL_CONTEXT_FACTORY,
"weblogic.jndi.WLInitialContextFactory");
properties.put(Context.PROVIDER_URL, "t3://localhost:7001"); // Enter
appropriate URL
properties.put(Context.SECURITY_PRINCIPAL, "system"); // Login
properties.put(Context.SECURITY_CREDENTIALS, "paranoia"); // Password

//
// Create the initial context
//

context = new InitialContext(properties);

Subject: [junit] Help on testing EJBs


Hello All,

How do I access my EJB from a jUnit test. I am getting an error in
my setup method. More specifically, in the line:
" Object objref = initial.lookup("ViewFinder"); "
ViewFinder is the JNDI name for my EJB.

The exception returned in the line print is:
".Need to specify class name in environment or system property:
java.naming.factory.initial"

I think I am incorrectly specifing where the ViewFinder EJB is, but I
don't know how else to specify it.

I am pretty new to using EJBs and this is my first test using jUnit.
I am running my EJB on a Weblogic 5.1 app/web server.

Thanks for anyhelp,
Luis

-------BEGIN CODE-----------
